abstracts.cdata!:
The project was satisfactory,
            sustainability is likely, and both the Bank, and the
            Borrower performances were satisfactory, having met the
            project objectives in a timely fashion. Nonetheless, the key
            lessons indicate that more attention should be given to
            institutional components, rather than physical components,
            for as a whole, most reasons for slow decision making, and
            cost overruns, were of institutional origin, since not only
            did Albania lack trained professionals in modern technology,
            but sustainable, long-term policy frameworks, were issues
            which took precedence over management, or engineering ones.
            Thus, the lack of institutional capacity, coupled with the
            supervision approach of "advising", proved the
            need to demand, and implement, systematized decision-making
            practices, as requested by the borrower, with a good start,
            to be advanced into future operations. Furthermore, the lack
            of a permanent civil service, hindered the development of
            project objectives, whereas a parallel project could have
            improved, a progressive restructuring of the civil service,
            by reinforcing merit increase, compensation, and improved
            accountability, in spite of the obvious lack of immediate
            results, during implementation of this project.

18157546.majtheme: Urban development,Financial and private sector development

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the project are to:
            (a) assist the Ministry of Transport and Communications
            (MTC) and transport organizations to adopt market based
            transport policies; (b) accommodate the expected growth of
            road traffic by rehabilitating and completing/extending main
            roads and by improving their maintenance and safety; (c)
            develop the domestic contracting industry and increase
            employment; (d) improve operations, finances and safety at
            the main port of Durres; and (e) prepare to determine the
            future role of Albanian railways. The project includes:  (a)
            rehabilitation of about 65 km, and completion and
            construction of 19 km of main roads; (b) improvement of road
            maintenance in the Tirana district through provision of
            equipment; (c) repair of quays and port surfaces, and
            provision of equipment and spare parts for the port of
            Durres; (d) technical assistance and training for:  (i) the
            National Roads Department to implement the project, (ii) MTC
            to make investment decisions on the basis of economic
            criteria, further privatize the road transport and
            construction industries, reorganize the Ministry, and adopt
            market based regulations, increase taxes and user charges,
            and (iii) the Port of Durres Authority to improve
            operations, productivity and safety, to establish an
            autonomous port, to improve port finances, and to develop a
            manpower plan; and (e) studies to: (i) improve road safety,
            (ii) prepare a Master Plan for the port of Durres, and (iii)
            determine the future role of Albanian Railways.
